intro: Heteroneuron quoyanum, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its fronds can grow up to several meters in length, contributing to its striking appearance. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
